name: System D. Static IP-LAN
description:
**Configure static IP**   
 **Iface Name:** select the name of the network interface, usually it is eth0, eth1, enp9s0, etc...  
 **IP Router:** type the ip of the router, usually it is found automatically but if it is wrong you have to change it  
 **Enter the NetMask** type the netmask, usually it is found automatically but if it is wrong you have to change it  
 **IP address for this pc:** write the desired ip, it should be the same as that of the router changing only the last digit  
 **Disable DHCP:** with static ip the dhcp is no longer needed it is better to disable it  
 . 
.
